node.title: Joe Biden's government to donate another $308 million to impoverished Afghanistan
node.description: The US is also providing Afghanistan with COVID vaccines.
node.content: ["The Biden administration plans to donate an extra US$308 million in humanitarian aid to Afghanistan, bringing total United States aid for the impoverished country and Afghan refugees in the region to nearly $782 million since October, the White House said on Tuesday.\n", "It's also providing 1 million additional coronavirus vaccine doses to Afghanistan, bringing the total to 4.3 million doses, the White House added.", "The assistance from the US Agency for International Development will be channelled through independent humanitarian organisations to provide shelter, health care, winterisation assistance, emergency food aid, water, sanitation and hygiene services, the government said.", "Nearly 23 Afghan million people - about 55 percent of the population - are facing extreme levels of hunger, with nearly 9 million at risk of famine as winter takes hold, the UN says.", "Afghanistan's economic crisis accelerated after the Taliban seized power in August, as the former Western-backed government collapsed and the last US troops withdrew.", "Last month, the United States formally exempted US and UN officials doing permitted business with the Taliban from Washington sanctions to try to maintain the flow of aid to Afghanistan as it sinks deeper into a humanitarian crisis."]
